files to be disabled.

xdg.dataFile.<name>.executable.description:
Set the execute bit. If `null`, defaults to the mode
of the {var}`source` file or to `false`
for files created through the {var}`text` option.

xdg.dataFile.<name>.onChange.description:
Shell commands to run when file has changed between
generations. The script will be run
*after* the new files have been linked
into place.

Note, this code is always run when `recursive` is
enabled.

xdg.dataFile.<name>.recursive.description:
If the file source is a directory, then this option
determines whether the directory should be recursively
linked to the target location. This option has no effect
if the source is a file.

If `false` (the default) then the target
will be a symbolic link to the source directory. If
`true` then the target will be a
directory structure matching the source's but whose leafs
are symbolic links to the files of the source directory.

xdg.dataFile.<name>.source.description:
Path of the source file or directory. If
[](#opt-xdg.dataFile._name_.text)
is non-null then this option will automatically point to a file
containing that text.

xdg.dataFile.<name>.target.description: Path to target file relative to <varname>xdg.dataHome</varname>.

xdg.dataFile.<name>.text.description:
Text of the file. If this option is null then
[](#opt-xdg.dataFile._name_.source)
must be set.

xdg.dataHome.description: Absolute path to directory holding application data.

xdg.desktopEntries.description:
Desktop Entries allow applications to be shown in your desktop environment's app launcher.

You can define entries for programs without entries or override existing entries.

See <https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/desktop-entry-spec-latest.html#recognized-keys> for more information on options.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.description: The set of actions made available to application launchers.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.description: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.
Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.categories.description: Categories in which the entry should be shown in a menu.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.exec.description: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.icon.description: Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.mimeType.description: The MIME type(s) supported by this application.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.noDisplay.description:
Means "this application exists, but don't display it in the menus".
This can be useful to e.g. associate this application with MIME types.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.prefersNonDefa.description: If true, the application prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.settings.description:
Extra key-value pairs to add to the `[Desktop Entry]` section.
This may override other values.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.startupNotify.description:
If true, it is KNOWN that the application will send a "remove"
message when started with the `DESKTOP_STARTUP_ID`
environment variable set. If false, it is KNOWN that the application
does not work with startup notification at all.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.terminal.description: Whether the program runs in a terminal window.

xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.type.description: The type of the desktop entry.

xdg.enable.description: Whether to enable management of XDG base directories.

default.text: true if host platform is Linux, false otherwise

xdg.mime.enable.description:
Whether to install programs and files to support the
XDG Shared MIME-info specification and XDG MIME Applications
specification at
<https://specifications.freedesktop.org/shared-mime-info-spec/shared-mime-info-spec-latest.html>
and
<https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mime-apps-spec/mime-apps-spec-latest.html>,
respectively.

xdg.mimeApps.associations.added.description:
Defines additional associations of applications with
mimetypes, as if the .desktop file was listing this mimetype
in the first place.
xdg.mimeApps.associations.added.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

xdg.mimeApps.associations.removed.description:
Removes associations of applications with mimetypes, as if the
.desktop file was *not* listing this
mimetype in the first place.
xdg.mimeApps.associations.removed.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

xdg.mimeApps.defaultApplications.description:
The default application to be used for a given mimetype. This
is, for instance, the one that will be started when
double-clicking on a file in a file manager. If the
application is no longer installed, the next application in
the list is attempted, and so on.
xdg.mimeApps.defaultApplications.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

xdg.mimeApps.enable.description:
Whether to manage {file}`$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mimeapps.list`.

The generated file is read-only.

xdg.portal.config.description:
Sets which portal backend should be used to provide the implementation
for the requested interface. For details check {manpage}`portals.conf(5)`.

These will be written with the name `$desktop-portals.conf` for
`xdg.portal.config.$desktop` and `portals.conf` for
`xdg.portal.config.common` as an exception.

These, together with `xdg.portal.configPackages`, will be joined into a
directory and passed to `xdg-desktop-portal.service` through a
`NIXOS_XDG_DESKTOP_PORTAL_CONFIG_DIR` variable.
xdg.portal.config.type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)

xdg.portal.configPackages.description:
List of packages that provide XDG desktop portal configuration, usually in
the form of `share/xdg-desktop-portal/$desktop-portals.conf`.

Note that configs in `xdg.portal.config` will be preferred if set.

xdg.portal.extraPortals.description:
List of additional portals that should be passed to the
`xdg-desktop-portal.service`, via the `XDG_DESKTOP_PORTAL_DIR`
variable.

Portals allow interaction with system, like choosing files or taking
screenshots. At minimum, a desktop portal implementation should be
listed.

xdg.portal.xdgOpenUsePortal.description:
Sets environment variable `NIXOS_XDG_OPEN_USE_PORTAL` to `1`
This will make `xdg-open` use the portal to open programs, which resolves bugs involving
programs opening inside FHS envs or with unexpected env vars set from wrappers.
See [#160923](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/160923) for more info.

xdg.stateHome.description: Absolute path to directory holding application states.

xdg.systemDirs.config.description:
Directory names to add to {env}`XDG_CONFIG_DIRS`
in the user session.

xdg.systemDirs.data.description:
Directory names to add to {env}`XDG_DATA_DIRS`
in the user session.

xdg.userDirs.createDirectories.description: Whether to enable automatic creation of the XDG user directories.

xdg.userDirs.desktop.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.documents.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.download.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.enable.description:
Whether to manage {file}`$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/user-dirs.dirs`.

The generated file is read-only.

xdg.userDirs.extraConfig.type: attribute set of (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.music.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.pictures.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.publicShare.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.templates.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xdg.userDirs.videos.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

xfconf.settings.description: Settings to write to the Xfconf configuration system.

xresources.extraConfig.description:
Additional X server resources contents.
If this and all other xresources options are
`null`, then this feature is disabled and no
{file}`~/.Xresources` link is produced.

xresources.path.description: Path where Home Manager should link the {file}`.Xresources` file.

xresources.properties.description:
X server resources that should be set.
Booleans are formatted as "true" or "false" respectively.
List elements are recursively formatted as a string and joined by commas.
All other values are directly formatted using builtins.toString.
Note, that 2-dimensional lists are not supported and specifying one will throw an exception.
If this and all other xresources options are
`null`, then this feature is disabled and no
{file}`~/.Xresources` link is produced.
xresources.properties.type: null or (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or string)))

xsession.initExtra.description: Extra shell commands to run during initialization.

xsession.preferStatusNotifierItems.description:
Whether tray applets should prefer using the Status Notifier
Items (SNI) protocol, commonly called App Indicators. Note,
not all tray applets or status bars support SNI.

xsession.profileExtra.description: Extra shell commands to run before session start.

xsession.profilePath.description:
Path, relative to {env}`HOME`, where Home Manager
should write the X profile script.

xsession.scriptPath.description:
Path, relative to {env}`HOME`, where Home Manager
should write the X session script.

xsession.windowManager.awesome.enable.description: Whether to enable Awesome window manager.

xsession.windowManager.awesome.luaModule.description:
List of lua packages available for being
used in the Awesome configuration.

xsession.windowManager.awesome.noArgb.description:
Disable client transparency support, which can be greatly
detrimental to performance in some setups

xsession.windowManager.awesome.package.description: Package to use for running the Awesome WM.

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.alwaysReset.description:
If set to `true`, desktops configured in {option}`monitors` will be reset
every time the config is run.

If set to `false`, desktops will only be configured the first time the config is run.
This is useful if you want to dynamically add desktops and you don't want them to be destroyed if you
re-run `bspwmrc`.

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.enable.description: Whether to enable bspwm window manager.

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.extraConfig.description: Additional shell commands to be run at the end of the config file.
Like extraConfig, except commands are run at the start of the config file.

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.monitors.description: Specifies the names of desktops to create on each monitor.
xsession.windowManager.bspwm.monitors.type: attribute set of list of string

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.description: Rule configuration. The keys of the attribute set are the targets of the rules.
xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.type: attribute set of (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string))

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name.description: Whether the node should have border.
Whether the node will be put in the center, in floating mode.
The desktop where the rule should be applied.
Whether the node should gain focus on creation.
Whether focus should follow the node when it is moved.
Whether the node should occupy any space.
The layer where a new window should spawn.

Whether the node should ignore {command}`node --close`
messages.

Whether the window should be managed by bspwm. If false, the window
will be ignored by bspwm entirely. This is useful for overlay apps,
e.g. screenshot tools.
Whether the node will be marked for deferred actions.
The monitor where the rule should be applied.
The node where the rule should be applied.
Whether the node should stay in the same tiling position and size.
The node's geometry, in the format `WxH+X+Y`.
The direction where the container is going to be split.

The ratio between the new window and the previous existing window in
the desktop.
The state in which a new window should spawn.
Whether the node should stay on the focused desktop.

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.settings.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string))

xsession.windowManager.bspwm.startupProg.description: Programs to be executed during startup.

xsession.windowManager.command.description:
Command to use to start the window manager.

The default value allows integration with NixOS' generated xserver configuration.

Extra actions and commands can be specified in {option}`xsession.initExtra`.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.apps.description:
Apps configuration for Fluxbox, written to
{file}`~/.fluxbox/apps`. Look at the
{manpage}`fluxbox(1)` manpage for details.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.enable.description: Whether to enable Fluxbox window manager.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.extraComm.description:
Extra command line arguments to pass to {command}`fluxbox`.
Look at the
{manpage}`fluxbox(1)` manpage for details.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.init.description:
Init configuration for Fluxbox, written to
{file}`~/.fluxbox/init`. Look at the
{manpage}`fluxbox(1)` manpage for details.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.keys.description:
Keyboard shortcuts configuration for Fluxbox, written to
{file}`~/.fluxbox/keys`. Look at the
{manpage}`fluxbox-keys(1)` manpage for details.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.menu.description:
Menu configuration for Fluxbox, written to
{file}`~/.fluxbox/menu`. Look at the
{manpage}`fluxbox-menu(1)` manpage for details.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.slitlist.description:
Slitlist configuration for Fluxbox, written to
{file}`~/.fluxbox/slitlist`. Look at the
{manpage}`fluxbox(1)` manpage for details.

xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.windowmen.description:
Window menu configuration for Fluxbox, written to
{file}`~/.fluxbox/windowmenu`. Look at the
{manpage}`fluxbox-menu(1)`
manpage for details.

xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.enab.description: Whether to enable herbstluftwm window manager.

xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.extr.description:
Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to
{file}`$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/herbstluftwm/autostart`.

xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.sett.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns.description:
An attribute set that assigns applications to workspaces based
on criteria.
xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns.type: attribute set of list of attribute set of (string or boolean)

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.description: i3 bars settings blocks. Set to empty list to remove bars completely.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description:
Bar color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules
with 'border', 'background', 'text', fields and RGB color hex-codes as values.
See default values for the reference.
Note that 'background', 'status', and 'separator' parameters take a single RGB value.

See <https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_colors>.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace is active.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Background color of the bar.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Border, background and text color for the binding mode indicator
Background color of the bar on the currently focused monitor output.
Text color to be used for the separator on the currently focused monitor output.
Text color to be used for the statusline on the currently focused monitor output.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace has focus.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description:
Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace does not
have focus and is not active.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Text color to be used for the separator.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Text color to be used for the statusline.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description:
Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace contains
a window with the urgency hint set.
Command that will be used to start a bar.
Extra configuration lines for this bar.
Font configuration for this bar.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: The default bar mode when 'bar.mode' == 'hide'.

Specifies the bar ID for the configured bar instance.
If this option is missing, the ID is set to bar-x, where x corresponds
to the position of the embedding bar block in the config file.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Bar visibility mode.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: The edge of the screen i3bar should show up.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Command that will be used to get status lines.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Where to output tray.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description:
Sets the pixel padding of the system tray.
This padding will surround the tray on all sides and between each item.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Whether workspace buttons should be shown or not.

default.text: null for state version ≥ 20.09, as example otherwise

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*..description: Whether workspace numbers should be displayed within the workspace buttons.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.description:
Color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules
with 'border', 'background', 'text', 'indicator' and 'childBorder' fields
and RGB color hex-codes as values. See default values for the reference.
Note that 'i3.config.colors.background' parameter takes a single RGB value.

See <https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_changing_colors>.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors..description:
Background color of the window. Only applications which do not cover
the whole area expose the color.
A window which currently has the focus.

A window which is the focused one of its container,
but it does not have the focus at the moment.

Background and text color are used to draw placeholder window
contents (when restoring layouts). Border and indicator are ignored.
A window which is not focused.
A window which has its urgency hint activated.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.default.description:
The default workspace to show when i3 is launched.
This must to correspond to the value of the keybinding of the default workspace.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floatin.description: List of criteria for windows that should be opened in a floating mode.
xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floatin.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean)

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floatin.description: Modifier key or keys that can be used to drag floating windows.

default.text:
''
  true for state version ≥ 23.05
  config.gaps == null for state version < 23.05
''

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floatin.description: Whether to show floating window titlebars.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.f.description: Whether focus should follow the mouse.

Whether to force focus wrapping in tabbed or stacked containers.

This option is deprecated, use {option}`focus.wrapping` instead.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.m.description:
Whether mouse cursor should be warped to the center of the window when switching focus
to a window on a different output.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.n.description:
This option modifies focus behavior on new window activation.

See <https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#focus_on_window_activation>

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.w.description:
Whether the window focus commands automatically wrap around the edge of containers.

See <https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_focus_wrapping>

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.fonts.description: Font configuration for window titles, nagbar...

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.sm.description:
This option controls whether to disable container borders on
workspace with a single container.

This option controls whether to disable all gaps (outer and inner)
on workspace with a single container.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keybind.description:
An attribute set that assigns a key press to an action using a key symbol.
See <https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings>.

Consider to use `lib.mkOptionDefault` function to extend or override
default keybindings instead of specifying all of them from scratch.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keycode.description:
An attribute set that assigns keypress to an action using key code.
See <https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings>.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modes.description:
An attribute set that defines binding modes and keybindings
inside them

Only basic keybinding is supported (bindsym keycomb action),
for more advanced setup use 'i3.extraConfig'.
xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modes.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modifie.description: Modifier key that is used for all default keybindings.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.description:
Commands that should be executed at startup.

See <https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#_automatically_starting_applications_on_i3_startup>.
Whether to run command on each i3 restart.
Command that will be executed on startup.

Whether to enable startup-notification support for the command.
See {option}`--no-startup-id` option description in the i3 user guide.

Launch application on a particular workspace. DEPRECATED:
Use [](#opt-xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns)
instead. See <https://github.com/nix-community/home-manager/issues/265>.

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window..description:
List of commands that should be executed on specific windows.
See {option}`for_window` i3wm option documentation.

Criteria of the windows on which command should be executed.

A value of `true` is equivalent to using an empty
criteria (which is different from an empty string criteria).
Hide window borders adjacent to the screen edges.

default.text:
''
  true for state version ≥ 23.05
  config.gaps == null for state version < 23.05
''

xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspa.description:
Assume you are on workspace "1: www" and switch to "2: IM" using
mod+2 because somebody sent you a message. You don’t need to remember
where you came from now, you can just press $mod+2 again to switch
back to "1: www".

The mode in which new containers on workspace level will
start.

Name(s) of the output(s) from {command}`
  i3-msg -t get_outputs
`.
Name of the workspace to assign.

xsession.windowManager.i3.enable.description: Whether to enable i3 window manager.

xsession.windowManager.i3.extraConfig.description: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/i3/config.

xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.enable.description: Whether to enable Spectrwm window manager.

xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.settings.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)

xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.unbindin.description: List of keybindings to disable from default Spectrwm configuration.

xsession.windowManager.xmonad.config.description:
The configuration file to be used for xmonad. This must be
an absolute path or `null` in which case
{file}`~/.xmonad/xmonad.hs` will not be managed
by Home Manager.

If this option is set to a non-`null` value,
recompilation of xmonad outside of Home Manager (e.g. via
{command}`xmonad --recompile`) will fail.

example.text:
pkgs.writeText "xmonad.hs" ''
  import XMonad
  main = xmonad defaultConfig
      { terminal    = "urxvt"
      , modMask     = mod4Mask
      , borderWidth = 3
      }
''

xsession.windowManager.xmonad.enable.description: Whether to enable xmonad window manager.

xsession.windowManager.xmonad.extraPacka.description:
Extra packages available to GHC when rebuilding xmonad. The
value must be a function which receives the attribute set
defined in {var}`haskellPackages` as the sole
argument.

xsession.windowManager.xmonad.haskellPac.description:
The {var}`haskellPackages` used to build xmonad
and other packages. This can be used to change the GHC
version used to build xmonad and the packages listed in
{var}`extraPackages`.

xsession.windowManager.xmonad.libFiles.description:
Additional files that will be saved in
{file}`~/.xmonad/lib/` and included in the configuration
build. The keys are the file names while the values are paths to the
contents of the files.
